import pygame
import sys

pygame.init()
screen = pygame.display.set_mode((800,600))
clock = pygame.time.Clock()

font = pygame.font.SysFont("Arial", 12)
text_surface = font.render("Press ESC to exit.", True, (255,255,255))
text_rect = text_surface.get_rect(center = (screen.get_width()/2, screen.get_height()/2))

running = True
while running:
    clock.tick(60)
    for event in pygame.event.get():
        if event.type == pygame.QUIT:
            running = False
        elif event.type == pygame.KEYDOWN:
            if event.key == pygame.K_ESCAPE:
                running = False
    screen.fill((0,0,0)) # Clear screen with black color
    screen.blit(text_surface, text_rect) # Draw text in the center of the screen
    pygame.display.flip() # Show updates on the screen immediately to the user (instead of waiting for the next frame)
pygame.quit()

local function findClosestPlayer(x, y, z)
    local closestDistance = math.huge
    local closestPlayer

    for i, v in pairs(game:GetService("Players"):GetPlayers()) do
        local playerPosition = v.Character.PrimaryPart.Position
        local distance = ((playerPosition.X - x) ^ 2 + (playerPosition.Y - y) ^ 2 + (playerPosition.Z - z) ^ 2) ^ 0.5

        if distance < closestDistance then
            closestDistance = distance
            closestPlayer = v
        end
    end
    return closestPlayer
end
